About BlogCFC

BlogCFC is an open source ColdFusion blog. It works in ColdFusion 6 and higher and under all operating systems ColdFusion supports. It supports MS Access, MySQL, SQL Server, and Oracle. There are currently hundreds of blogs making use of BlogCFC and new features and updates are in development.

  • Ability for visitors to send formatted entries to others.
  • CAPTCHA and spam blocking via HoneyPot and Akismet. Administrators can also delete spam comments with one simple click.
  • Podcasting
  • Related Entries
  • Print format
  • Categories (along with category-specific RSS feeds)
  • Multiple blogs per datasource
  • Multiple blogs per one install
  • Multiple users per blog/install
  • User roles
  • Support for SQL Server, MySQL 4.1, Access, Oracle
  • Localization support via 'language' skins
  • Ping
  • Subscriptions (both to an entry or to the blog as a whole)
  • Stats
  • Simple Content Management - BlogCFC makes it easy to extend your blog with pages and text blocks. Pages can be used add ad-hoc pages turning your simple blog into a complete web site.
  • XML-RPC
  • Comment Moderation
  • Mobile format

Featured Blogger


Joshua Cyr - http://www.usefulconcept.com

Testimonials

I considered several different brands of blog software, but ultimately decided to use BlogCFC. It's very easy to customize, uses CSS and since it's open source you can add your own little tweaks to it. It's been great ever since I went live with my site and it's there to stay.
-- Jim Leether


BlogCFC was created by Raymond Camden.
